hints.content:
We need to know the total number of eggs before any hatched.

![A tape diagram models that the 57 hatched eggs and 53 eggs in the nest are equal to an unknown total number of eggs.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f6f4ad3ece4f3e638d075db9333da6741f5a75ce)

$\maroonD{57}+\blueE{53} = \purpleD{?}$

$\begin{align}
\maroonD{57}+\blueE{53} &=\maroonD{50}+\blueE{50} + \maroonD{7} + \blueE{3} \\\\
&= 100 +10
\\\\
&=\purpleD{110}
\end{align}$

![Place value blocks show 5 tens plus 5 tens plus 7 plus 3.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/42fcf217734d062c503b0d4bb1e41b90240ce9bc)
There were $\purpleD{110}$ eggs before any hatched.

question.content:
So far, $57$ sea turtle eggs have hatched and $53$ eggs are still in the nest.

**How many eggs were there before any hatched?**

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] eggs
